newsitem.title: USA: LPGA GOLF-KING AND ROBBINS TIED ENTERING FINAL ROUND.
newsitem.headline: LPGA GOLF-KING AND ROBBINS TIED ENTERING FINAL ROUND.

text.p: Two-time champion Betsy King shot a five-under par 67 on Saturday to move into a tie with Kelly Robbins entering the final round of the Nabisco Dinah Shore golf tournament.
Robbins, seeking her first win in the Dinah Shore, shot a 68.
Through 54 holes, both King and Robbins are at 11-under par 205. Amy Fruhwirth, a non-winner on the LPGA, shot a 68 and is two shots back.
King, who won here in 1987 and 1990, has not won since the ShopRite LPGA Classic in 1995 and is coming off one of her worst seasons.

"It is so good to see Betsy playing well," Robbins said. "She struggled for awhile. She's such a great player. I haven't seen her hit the ball that well in a long time. It's neat for Betsy and good for the game to see her back."
King has not had a bogey since the last hole of her first round, a string that reached 36 holes on Saturday.
"I'm very happy with the way I played," she said. "I drove it very well. I didn't miss a fairway and that's a key out here."

Robbins' round was more erratic. She mixed two bogeys in with four birdies and an eagle. The latter came at the par-5 11th hole, where she reached the green with a 5-wood second shot, then holed a 12-foot putt.
"I was just trying to hang in there," she said. "It seems like every day I walk off the golf course with a headache. There are no holes you can relax on."
Fruhwirth is seeking her first professional victory.
"I'm very proud of myself," she said. "I kept my composure. I felt pretty good. I was calm. I couldn't ask for anything more, except maybe winning."
